p:
This paper proposes learning objectives that integrate climate change and health literature,
8-14 pedagogical theory,
65, 66, 72, 73 and the authors’ teaching and clinical practice experience ( Table 1). In particular, the objectives incorporate perspectives from the Sustainable Health Education Network’s priority learning outcomes on sustainability and health;
14 Australian Medical Council standards,
49 and the Australia College of Rural and Remote Medicine curriculum competencies.
11 The objectives engage conceptual and affective learning; involve higher-order cognitive skills such as analysis, synthesis and evaluation; and expect students to apply this knowledge to the clinical context.
